Direct sequencing of the PAF-2 gene revealed a homozygous 1-bp insertion at nucleotide 511 (511 insT) in one patient with group C Zellweger syndrome (ZS), which introduces a premature termination codon in the PAF-2 gene, and, in the second patient, revealed a splice-site mutation in intron 3 (IVS3+1G-->A) having skipped exon 3, an event that leads to peroxisome deficiency.

Direct sequencing of the PAF-2 gene revealed a homozygous 1-bp insertion at nucleotide 511 (511 insT) in one patient with group C Zellweger syndrome (ZS), which introduces a premature termination codon in the PAF-2 gene, and, in the second patient, revealed a splice-site mutation in intron 3 (IVS3+1G-->A) observed to skip exon 3, an event that leads to peroxisome deficiency.

Direct sequencing of the PAF-2 gene revealed a homozygous 1-bp insertion at nucleotide 511 (511 insT) in one patient with group C Zellweger syndrome (ZS), which introduces a premature termination codon in the PAF-2 gene, and, in the second patient, revealed a splice-site mutation in intron 3 (IVS3+1G-->A) shown to skip exon 3, an event that leads to peroxisome deficiency.

Direct sequencing of the PAF-2 gene revealed a homozygous 1-bp insertion at nucleotide 511 (511 insT) in one patient with group C Zellweger syndrome (ZS), which introduces a premature termination codon in the PAF-2 gene, and, in the second patient, revealed a splice-site mutation in intron 3 (IVS3+1G-->A), which will skip exon 3, an event that leads to peroxisome deficiency.

In the case of the 12-membered ring macrolide, an acyl-enzyme intermediate on PikAIII can efficiently skip the last extension step and is cyclized by the TE domain of PikAIV, presumably as a result of a PikAIII-PikAIV interaction.

Megakaryocytes undergo an endomitotic cell cycle, which consists of an S phase interrupted by a gap, during which anaphase B and cytokinesis are able to be skipped by the cells.

Megakaryocytes undergo an endomitotic cell cycle, which consists of an S phase interrupted by a gap, during which the cells enter mitosis but are likely to skip anaphase B and cytokinesis.
Megakaryocytes undergo an endomitotic cell cycle, which consists of an S phase interrupted by a gap, during which the cells enter mitosis but may have skipped anaphase B and cytokinesis.
Megakaryocytes undergo an endomitotic cell cycle, which consists of an S phase interrupted by a gap, during which the cells enter mitosis but may have skipped anaphase B and cytokinesis.

example.text: Translation of this RNA is initiated by a ribosome shunt mechanism, in which a large region of the leader containing a putative RNA encapsidation signal has been skipped by ribosomes that translate the most 5-proximal short ORF (sORF A) and reinitiate translation at the first long viral ORF.
example.arg: a large region of the leader containing a putative RNA encapsidation signal
